Message.Title: obama in a nutshell
Message.Msg: Obama himself was never troubled by his lack of achievements, but why would he be? As many have noted, Obama was told he was good enough for Columbia despite undistinguished grades at Occidental; he was told he was good enough for the US Senate despite a mediocre record in Illinois; he was told he was good enough to be president despite no record at all in the Senate. All his life, every step of the way, Obama was told he was good enough for the next step, in spite of ample evidence to the contrary. In short: our president is a small-minded man, with neither the temperament nor the intellect to handle his job. When you understand that, and only when you understand that, will the current erosion of liberty and prosperity make sense. It could not have gone otherwise with such a man in the Oval Office.

Message.Title: OPEC Says Supply Ample, Speculation Driving Price
Message.Msg: OPEC Says Supply Ample, Speculation Driving Price.OPEC Says Supply Ample, Speculation Driving Price , | 03 July 2013 | 06:18 AM ET Oil supply will be more than sufficient to meet demand this year and beyond, OPEC's Secretary General said on Thursday, but added the price of fuel is being driven higher by speculation. "There has been no shortage of oil in the market. Producers have been able to meet consumer needs," Abdullah al-Badri told an energy conference. "We also see this as being the case for the rest of 2012 and the foreseeable future." Oil prices surged in March to $128 a barrel, the highest level since 2008, because of concern about possible supply shortages. Prices have since fallen back and brent crude was trading around $118 on Thursday. "Today the price continues to be driven by excessive speculation," Badri said. OPEC at a meeting in December set a target to produce 30 million barrels per day, settling an argument which broke out in 2011 after Iran and other members opposed a Saudi-led plan to raise OPEC's production ceiling. Output has remained above the target all year as Libyan supply recovered after being virtually shut down during the 2011 uprising against Muammar Gaddafi's rule. The extra oil is filling gaps caused by an unusually large number of supply outages globally, which have also helped support prices. Supply breaks were running at nearly 1.3 million bpd as of early April. The additional supply has also offset a decline in exports from Iran, which is facing stiffening western sanctions over its disputed nuclear energy program. Iranian oil exports were running at between 200,000 and 300,000 barrels per day below last year's level, Maria van der Hoeven, head of the International Energy Agency, told Thursday's conference. Iranian officials have said the country exported an average of 2.2 million barrels a day last year. July supply from the 12-member Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries ran at 31.75 million barrels per day (bpd),

Message.Title: Nancy Pelosi -- "The mandate was not delayed."
Message.Msg: The House Democratic leader used some creative reasoning to make her case -- she claimed the administration really only delayed the requirement on businesses to report insurance coverage details. But The Washington Post fact-checker on Friday shut it down, effectively ruling that Pelosi is trying to "deny reality." "Yes, reporting requirements were delayed. But there also was a one-year delay of the actual employer mandate. It's right there in the announcement," the Post wrote. Spin, Spin, SPIN it Nancy !!!! Don't let press releases get in the way of your spin !!!!

Message.Title: Have faith
Message.Msg: Some time ago I bout a few BAC shares @ about $9.75... Then it kept on dropping to less than $6.00. I went to do my usual banking one Saturday morning when one of the offices at this small branch in Miami offered some sort of a service. I told her I was depressed because BAC shares were below my purchase price and that I felt BAC was letting me down. She looked at me a little embarrassed and apologized but, without hesitation, she told me: "We are working very hard to fix our problems... Please, believe me... Things will eventually get better. Have faith in us... Things will be different and many people are working truly hard and honestly to be a great bank again." For some reason I believed the honesty of her words... and following Buffett's big purchase, I bought more than five times the amount of shares I already owned. Oh, boy... How much I appreciated this officer's honest conversation. I believe in America and its great institutions and its ability to correct things when they go out of their right path. I believed this honest woman and I had faith... Bank of America has rewarded me very handsomely these last twelve months... I took a risk based on faith and a bit of common sense... and this is just the beginning of the rebirth of a great institution. Have faith, lots of faith in America.

Topic.Title: Have faith

Message.Msg: Nice, heart warming story. But do you really believe that anyone working at any one branch is going to have a clue about the success of a nation wide bank? I'm sure everyone is working very hard to make the bank successful, but basing your stock purchases on a branch officer is almost as bad as taking the advice of any of the investment advice of people who post here. Time and patience is the best adviser regarding BAC shares. In the long run the stock will do well but it is certainly going to have its ups and downs.

Message.Title: holder travels like a sultan, during squester
Message.Msg: U.S. Attorney General Eric Holder took 62 out-of-town trips in fiscal year 2011 at a cost of at least $1.45 million, according to a set of disclosures sent to Bloomberg News. Holder’s travel during the period included an April 2011 trip to Las Vegas, marked business and personal, that cost $46,358. Nine other trips, including visits to Martha’s Vineyard, Massachusetts, and Miami, were labeled “personal,” and cost a combined $169,502. He took an $83,002 flight to Krakow, Poland, to attend the G-6 summit. Flight costs for seven trips, including journeys to China, Hawaii and Brussels, weren’t provided
